Question
========

Consider the following admission data from a university. Here are the data:


|		| Applicants| Admitted     |
|:-------------:|:---------:|:------------:|
| Men		| 8442	    | 44% 	   |
| Women         | 4321      | 35%          |


And the same data when we consider at the department level:

|            |	  Men  		       |   Women             |
|:----------:|:-----------------------:|:-------------------:|
| Departments| Applicants| Admitted    |Applicants| Admitted |
|:----------:|:----------|------------:|:---------|---------:|
A 	     |	825	 |       62%   |   108	  |      82% |
B            |	560      |       63%   |   25	  |      68% |
C	     |	325	 |       35%   |   593	  |      34% |
D	     |	417	 |       33%   |   375	  |      35% |
E	     |	191	 |       28%   |   393	  |      24% |
F	     |	272      |	  6%   |   341    |	7%   | 

Of people applying to the university, what is the distribution of the variable
sex? 

Answerlist
----------

* 66% are men and 34% are women
* Men are more likely to be admitted than women
* 44% are men and 35% are women
* There are more women applicants than men


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True
* False
* False
* False
